candidates.text: Resource allocation conflicts between projects weekly

selectedCandidate: Resource allocation conflicts between projects weekly

autopsy.originsConstraints: Created by a vendor implementation that optimized for their product, not your workflow. The consulting industry had different pressures then, and the process reflected that reality.
autopsy.assumptionsWorkarounds: Everyone assumes this requires human judgment, but 80% is actually pattern matching. Meanwhile, people have built workarounds: informal networks that bypass the official channels.
autopsy.stakesOutcomes: The real goal is better quality, but the process has become the focus instead. The real goal is better quality, but the current process has become an end in itself.

workflow.aiDoes: Collects data from multiple sources, runs initial analysis, flags anomalies
workflow.humanDoes: Validates findings, adds context AI can't access, makes final calls
workflow.reasoning: AI excels at this type of work. Human relationships matter here.

workflow.aiDoes: Drafts communications, maintains consistency, handles routine updates
workflow.humanDoes: Reviews for tone, handles sensitive messages, manages relationships
workflow.reasoning: Routine enough for AI with this type of work. Judgment calls are frequent.

workflow.aiDoes: Runs all standard checks, compares against requirements, documents findings
workflow.humanDoes: Reviews exceptions, makes judgment calls, signs off on final output
workflow.reasoning: Quality requires this type of work. Judgment calls are frequent.

workflow.aiDoes: Manages calendars, resolves conflicts, sends reminders, tracks completion
workflow.humanDoes: Handles escalations, makes priority decisions, manages exceptions
workflow.reasoning: AI excels at this type of work. Patterns are clear and repeatable.

workflow.aiDoes: Suggests templates, organizes information, maintains consistency
workflow.humanDoes: Provides expertise, validates accuracy, decides what matters
workflow.reasoning: Human judgment needed for this type of work. Patterns are clear and repeatable.

desuck.learning: Track throughput weekly. Feed human corrections back to improve AI recommendations. Review collaboration modes monthly and adjust based on what's working.

transition.humanElement: Start with the most receptive department. Get operations aligned before expanding.
transition.pilotPlan: Run a one-month pilot with new hires only. Measure before and after, then scale based on results.
